<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Acid Splash](/Spells.aspx?ID=3)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Acid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=3" />
<trait label="Attack" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=15" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 316 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Bloodline**
[Demonic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You splash a glob of acid that splatters your target and nearby creatures. Make a spell attack. If you hit, you deal 1d6 acid damage plus 1 splash acid damage. On a critical success, the target also takes 1 persistent acid damage.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The initial damage increases to 2d6, and the persistent damage increases to 2.

**Heightened (5th)** The initial damage increases to 3d6, the persistent damage increases to 3, and the splash damage increases to 2.

**Heightened (7th)** The initial damage increases to 4d6, the persistent damage increases to 4, and the splash damage increases to 3.

**Heightened (9th)** The initial damage increases to 5d6, the persistent damage increases to 5, and the splash damage increases to 4.
_source.name: Acid Splash

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Air Bubble](/Spells.aspx?ID=5)
<actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Air" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=5" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 316 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

**Trigger** A creature within range enters an environment where it can't breathe.

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** the triggering creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A bubble of pure air appears around the target's head, allowing it to breathe normally. The effect ends as soon as the target returns to an environment where it can breathe normally.
_source.name: Air Bubble

_source.markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Alarm](/Spells.aspx?ID=7)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 317 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 10 minutes ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

**Requirements** 3 gp silver bell focus
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 8 hours
</row>

</column>

---

You ward an area to alert you when creatures enter without your permission. When you cast _alarm_, select a password. Whenever a Small or larger corporeal creature enters the spell's area without speaking the password, _alarm_ sends your choice of a mental alert (in which case the spell gains the mental trait) or an audible alarm with the sound and volume of a hand bell (in which case the spell gains the auditory trait). Either option automatically awakens you, and the bell allows each creature in the area to attempt a DC 15 Perception check to wake up. A creature aware of the alarm must succeed at a [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) check against the spell's DC or trigger the spell when moving into the area.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can specify criteria for which creatures sound the _alarm_ spell—for instance, orcs or masked people.
_source.name: Alarm

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Bane](/Spells.aspx?ID=18)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 320 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 5-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** 
Will

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt. Enemies in the area must succeed at a Will save or take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area. Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast _bane_, you can use a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw. _Bane_ can [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) [_bless_](/Spells.aspx?ID=25).
_source.name: Bane

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Bless](/Spells.aspx?ID=25)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

**Area** 5-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Blessings from beyond help your companions strike true. You and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls while within the emanation. Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast _bless_, you can use a single action, which has the [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet. _Bless_ can [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) [_bane_](/Spells.aspx?ID=18).

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 322 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Bloodlines** [Diabolic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=7), [Nymph](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=12) **Deities** [Ardad Lili](/Deities.aspx?ID=167), [Asmodeus](/Deities.aspx?ID=278), [Belial](/Deities.aspx?ID=65), [Calistria](/Deities.aspx?ID=279), [Conqueror Worm](/Deities.aspx?ID=234), [Hathor](/Deities.aspx?ID=52), [Nalinivati](/Deities.aspx?ID=313), [Ravithra](/Deities.aspx?ID=218), [Sturovenen](/Deities.aspx?ID=173), [The Green Mother](/Deities.aspx?ID=93), [Zura](/Deities.aspx?ID=83) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** 1 hour --- To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.
**Success** The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of _charm_, unless it identifies the spell (see [Identifying Spells](/Rules.aspx?ID=298)).
**Failure** The target's attitude becomes friendly toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you.
**Critical Failure** The target's attitude becomes helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you. --- **Heightened (4th)** The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations. **Heightened (8th)** The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
_source.name: Charm

_source.summary_markdown: A creature becomes more friendly to you.
_source.text: Charm Two Actions Source Core Rulebook pg. 322 4.0 Traditions Arcane, Occult, Primal Bloodlines Diabolic, Fey, Nymph Deities Ardad Lili, Asmodeus, Belial, Calistria, Conqueror Worm, Hathor, Nalinivati, Ravithra, Sturovenen, The Green Mother, Zura Cast somatic, verbal Range 30 feet Target 1 creature Saving Throw Will Duration 1 hour --- To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means. Critical Success The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it. Success The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm , unless it identifies the spell (see Identifying Spells). Failure The target's attitude becomes friendly toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you. Critical Failure The target's attitude becomes helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you. --- Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations. Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 323 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Bloodlines** [Undead](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=10), [Shadow](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=14) **Mystery** [Bones](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** touch **Target** 1 living or undead creature **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- Siphoning negative energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.
  • **Living Creature** The spell deals negative damage equal to 1d4 plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round on a critical failure.
  • **Undead Creature** The target is flat-footed for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also fleeing for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.
--- **Heightened (+1)** The negative damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 325 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Patron Themes** [Fervor](/Patrons.aspx?ID=4), [Pacts](/Patrons.aspx?ID=11) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** until the end of the target's next turn --- You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), release what it's holding, drop prone, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save. **Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Failure** For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.
**Critical Failure** The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command. --- **Heightened (5th)** You can target up to 10 creatures.

Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. You receive no information beyond presence or absence. You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment. Only creatures of 6th level or higher—unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere—have alignment auras. --- **Heightened (2nd)** You learn each aura's location and strength. Alignment Aura The strength of an alignment aura depends on the level of the creature, item, or spell. The auras of undead, clerics and other divine spellcasters with a patron deity, and creatures from the Outer Sphere are one step stronger than normal (faint instead of none, for example). ## Alignment Aura
**Creature or Item Level****Spell or Effect Level****Aura Strength**
0-5—None
6-100-3Faint
11-154-7Moderate
16-208-9Powerful
21+10Overwhelming

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 328 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Bloodlines**
[Imperial](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=9), [Genie](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=11), [Phoenix](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=15), [Harrow](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=18)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 30-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

 You detect [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of your _detect magic_ spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an [_invisibility potion_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=287)) typically are detected normally.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

**Heightened (4th)** As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an [imprecise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=412), you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
_source.name: Detect Magic

You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies. You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion ) typically are detected normally. --- Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn. Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

You unleash a beam of divine energy. Choose an alignment your deity has (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful). You can't cast this spell if you don't have a deity or if your deity is true neutral. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target's AC. On a hit, the target takes damage of the chosen alignment type equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier (double damage on a critical hit). **Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

[Adanye](/Deities.aspx?ID=223), [Ma'at](/Deities.aspx?ID=55), [Ylimancha](/Deities.aspx?ID=132)

<row gap="medium">

**Trigger** a creature within range is falling

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 falling creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You cause the air itself to arrest a fall. The target's fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If the target reaches the ground while the spell is in effect, it takes no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as the target lands.

---

A disk of magical force materializes adjacent to you. This disk is 2 feet in diameter and follows 5 feet behind you, floating just above the ground. It holds up to 5 Bulk of objects (though they must be able to fit and balance on its surface). Any objects atop the disk fall to the ground when the spell ends.

 The spell ends if a creature tries to ride atop the disk, if the disk is overloaded, if anyone tries to lift or force the disk higher above the ground, or if you move more than 30 feet away from the disk.

_source.text: Floating Disk Two Actions Source Core Rulebook pg. 339 4.0 Traditions Arcane, Occult Deities Casandalee, Horus Cast somatic, verbal Duration 8 hours --- A disk of magical force materializes adjacent to you. This disk is 2 feet in diameter and follows 5 feet behind you, floating just above the ground. It holds up to 5 Bulk of objects (though they must be able to fit and balance on its surface). Any objects atop the disk fall to the ground when the spell ends. The spell ends if a creature tries to ride atop the disk, if the disk is overloaded, if anyone tries to lift or force the disk higher above the ground, or if you move more than 30 feet away from the disk.

[Forbidding Ward](/Spells.aspx?ID=126)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 339 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 ally and 1 enemy
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You ward an ally against the attacks and hostile spells from the target enemy. The target ally gains a +1 status bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against the target enemy's attacks, spells, and other effects.

---
**Heightened (6th)** The status bonus increases to +2.

<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 340 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodline**
[Fey](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=7)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained
</row>

</column>

---

You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The range increases to 60 feet.

**Heightened (5th)** The range increases to 120 feet.
_source.name: Ghost Sound

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 342 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deities** [Picoperi](/Deities.aspx?ID=266), [The Perplexing Jest](/Deities.aspx?ID=271), [Trelmarixian](/Deities.aspx?ID=137) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 4 contiguous 5-foot squares or **Target** 1 object of Bulk 1 or less **Duration** 1 minute --- You conjure grease, with effects based on choosing area or target.
  • **Area** All solid ground in the area is covered with grease. Each creature standing on the greasy surface must succeed at a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check against your spell DC or fall prone. Creatures using an action to move onto the greasy surface during the spell's duration must attempt either a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check to Balance. A creature that Steps or Crawls doesn't have to attempt a check or save.
  • **Target** If you cast the spell on an unattended object, anyone trying to pick up the object must succeed at an Acrobatics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to do so. If you target an attended object, the creature that has the object must attempt an Acrobatics check or Reflex save. On a failure, the holder or wielder takes a –2 circumstance penalty to all checks that involve using the object; on a critical failure, the holder or wielder releases the item. The object lands in an adjacent square of the GM's choice. If you cast this spell on a worn object, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to grapple them.
_source.name: Grease

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 342 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Bloodline** [Shadow](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=14) **Deities** [Charon](/Deities.aspx?ID=135), [Dajermube](/Deities.aspx?ID=235), [Fumeiyoshi](/Deities.aspx?ID=305), [Nhimbaloth](/Deities.aspx?ID=163), [Nyarlathotep (Haunter in the Dark)](/Deities.aspx?ID=222), [Orcus](/Deities.aspx?ID=241), [Treerazer](/Deities.aspx?ID=324) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Area** 30-foot line **Saving Throw** Fortitude --- Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal 2d4 negative damage and 1 persistent bleed damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half the negative damage and no persistent bleed damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double negative damage and double persistent bleed damage. --- **Heightened (+1)** The negative damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.
_source.name: Grim Tendrils

---

You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 342 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deities** [Gozreh](/Deities.aspx?ID=284), [Hei Feng](/Deities.aspx?ID=307), [Hshurha](/Deities.aspx?ID=103), [Pazuzu](/Deities.aspx?ID=79), [Seafarer's Hope](/Deities.aspx?ID=255), [Sky Keepers](/Deities.aspx?ID=232) **Patron Theme** [Winter](/Patrons.aspx?ID=8) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Area** 60-foot line **Saving Throw** Fortitude **Duration** until the start of your next turn --- A violent wind issues forth from your palm, blowing from the point where you are when you cast the spell to the line's opposite end. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects. Large or smaller creatures in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Large or smaller creatures that later move into the gust must attempt the save on entering. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature can't move against the wind.
**Failure** The creature is knocked prone. If it was flying, it suffers the effects of critical failure instead.
**Critical Failure** The creature is pushed 30 feet in the wind's direction, knocked prone, and takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage.
_source.name: Gust of Wind

If the target is a living creature, you deal 1d8 negative damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, you restore that amount of Hit Points. <title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 345 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodlines**
[Hag](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=8), [Genie](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=11)

**Deities**
[Hastur](/Deities.aspx?ID=162), [Likha](/Deities.aspx?ID=192), [Mahathallah](/Deities.aspx?ID=170), [Nivi Rhombodazzle](/Deities.aspx?ID=44), [Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=289), [Sivanah](/Deities.aspx?ID=46), [The Lantern King](/Deities.aspx?ID=95)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

 Casting _illusory disguise_ counts as setting up a disguise for the [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) use of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5); it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) and [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246) traits.

**Heightened (3rd)** You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.
_source.name: Illusory Disguise

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Illusory Object](/Spells.aspx?ID=160)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 345 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Abadar](/Deities.aspx?ID=277), [Findeladlara](/Deities.aspx?ID=109)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 500 feet

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.

 Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) and [olfactory](/Traits.aspx?ID=246) traits. The duration increases to 1 hour.

**Heightened (5th)** As the 2nd-level version, but the duration is unlimited.
_source.name: Illusory Object

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Item Facade](/Spells.aspx?ID=166)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 347 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object no more than 10 feet by 10 feet by 10 feet
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You make the target object look and feel as though it were in much better or worse physical condition. When you cast this spell, decide whether you want to make the object look decrepit or perfect. An item made to look decrepit appears broken and shoddy. An intact item made to look better appears as though it's brand new and highly polished or well maintained. A broken item appears to be intact and functional. Destroyed items can't be affected by this spell. A creature that Interacts with the item can attempt to disbelieve the illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration is 24 hours.

**Heightened (3rd)** The duration is unlimited.
_source.name: Item Facade

<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Move" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=114" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 347 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Gogunta](/Deities.aspx?ID=321), [Irori](/Deities.aspx?ID=286), [Jin Li](/Deities.aspx?ID=308), [Kabriri](/Deities.aspx?ID=76), [Sun Wukong](/Deities.aspx?ID=316), [The Divine Dare](/Deities.aspx?ID=269)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Your legs surge with strength, ready to leap high and far. You jump 30 feet in any direction without touching the ground. You must land on a space of solid ground within 30 feet of you, or else you fall after using your next action.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The range becomes touch, the target changes to one touched creature, and the duration becomes 1 minute, allowing the target to jump as described whenever it takes the Leap action.

_source.text: Light Two Actions Source Core Rulebook pg. 348 4.0 Traditions Arcane, Divine, Occult, Primal Spell Lists Elemental Bloodline Angelic Cast somatic, verbal Range touch Target 1 object of 1 Bulk or less, either unattended or possessed by you or a willing ally Duration until the next time you make your daily preparations --- The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends. --- Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Lock](/Spells.aspx?ID=174)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 348 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 lock, or a door or container with a latch
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations.
</row>

</column>

---

The target's latch mechanism clinks shut, held fast by unseen magical restraints. When you magically lock a target, you set an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) and [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) DC to open it equal to your spell DC or the base lock DC with a +4 status bonus, whichever is higher. Any key or combination that once opened a lock affected by this spell does not do so for the duration of the spell, though the key or combination does grant a +4 circumstance bonus to checks to open the door.

 If the target is opened, the spell ends. Assuming the target is not barred or locked in some additional way, you can unlock and open it with an Interact action during which you touch the target. This does not end the spell. You can Dismiss this spell at any time and from any distance.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration increases to unlimited, but you must expend 6 gp worth of gold dust as an additional cost.
_source.name: Lock

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Mage Armor](/Spells.aspx?ID=176)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 348 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Bloodline**
[Wyrmblessed](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=17)

**Deities**
[Arshea](/Deities.aspx?ID=113), [Demon Bringers](/Deities.aspx?ID=230), [Kazutal](/Deities.aspx?ID=41), [Keepers of the Hearth](/Deities.aspx?ID=248), [Lymnieris](/Deities.aspx?ID=124), [Milani](/Deities.aspx?ID=43), [Valmallos](/Deities.aspx?ID=147), [Vineshvakhi](/Deities.aspx?ID=262), [Wadjet](/Deities.aspx?ID=62)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of Protection](/Lessons.aspx?ID=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a +1 item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. While wearing _mage armor_, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

**Heightened (6th)** The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

**Heightened (8th)** The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.

**Heightened (10th)** The item bonus to AC increases to +3, and you gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.
_source.name: Mage Armor

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 349 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained
</row>

</column>

---

You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

**Heightened (5th)** The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

**Heightened (7th)** The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
_source.name: Mage Hand

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Magic Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=178)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 349 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute ([material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object of 3 bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the next time you make your daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You alter the appearance of an item's magic aura. You can choose to have the target's aura appear as that of a common magic item of twice _magic aura_'s level or lower, or to have it register as being under the effects of a spell of your choice of _magic aura_'s level or lower. If the target is [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), you can instead choose to have it appear as entirely non-magical.

 A caster using [_detect magic_](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) or [_read aura_](/Spells.aspx?ID=246) of an equal or higher spell level can attempt to disbelieve the illusion from _magic aura_. _Magic aura_ doesn't mask the aura of spells that are 9th level or higher or of items that are 19th level or higher.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target a creature instead of an object. When you do, you can either conceal the auras of all magic items it has or have that creature's aura appear as if it were under the effect of a spell you know.
_source.name: Magic Aura

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Magic Fang](/Spells.aspx?ID=179)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 349 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Angazhan](/Deities.aspx?ID=72), [Apsu](/Deities.aspx?ID=149), [Barbatos](/Deities.aspx?ID=64), [Dahak](/Deities.aspx?ID=150), [Rowdrosh](/Deities.aspx?ID=240), [Zevgavizeb](/Deities.aspx?ID=82)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Choose one of the target's [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attacks. You cause that unarmed attack to shine with primal energy. The unarmed attack becomes a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280)_ unarmed attack, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of damage dice to two if it had only one.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180)
<actions string="Single Action to Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
<trait label="Force" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=75" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 349 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodline**
[Imperial](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=9)

**Deities**
[Gravelady's Guard](/Deities.aspx?ID=247), [Lorthact](/Deities.aspx?ID=243), [Nethys](/Deities.aspx?ID=288)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** ([somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You send a dart of force streaking toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of missiles you shoot by one, to a maximum of three missiles for 3 actions. You choose the target for each missile individually. If you shoot more than one missile at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

---
**Heightened (+2)** You shoot one additional missile with each action you spend.
_source.name: Magic Missile

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Magic Weapon](/Spells.aspx?ID=182)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 349 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Patron Theme**
[Rune](/Patrons.aspx?ID=6)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 weapon that is unattended or wielded by you or a willing ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

The weapon glimmers with magic and energy. The target becomes a _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) weapon_, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two.
_source.name: Magic Weapon

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Mending](/Spells.aspx?ID=189)
<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 351 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 10 minutes ([somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** non-magical object of light Bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You repair the target item. You restore 5 Hit Points per spell level to the target, potentially removing the broken condition if this repairs it past the item's Broken Threshold. You can't replace lost pieces or repair an object that's been completely destroyed.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can target a non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less.

**Heightened (3rd)** You can target a non-magical object of 2 Bulk or less, or a magical object of 1 Bulk or less.
_source.name: Mending

_source.markdown:
<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=190)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Linguistic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=101" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 351 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** see below
</row>

</column>

---

You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The spell's range increases to 500 feet.
_source.name: Message

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Mindlink](/Spells.aspx?ID=195)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 352 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Eritrice](/Deities.aspx?ID=118), [Followers of Fate](/Deities.aspx?ID=322), [Imbrex](/Deities.aspx?ID=94), [Narriseminek](/Deities.aspx?ID=144), [Pharasma](/Deities.aspx?ID=290), [Suyuddha](/Deities.aspx?ID=245), [Torag](/Deities.aspx?ID=294)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.
_source.name: Mindlink

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Negate Aroma](/Spells.aspx?ID=206)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 354 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Skode](/Deities.aspx?ID=239)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

The target loses its odor, preventing creatures from passively noticing its presence via smell alone, even if the creatures have precise or imprecise scent. A creature attempting a Perception check to Seek with scent and other senses might notice the lack of natural scent. If the target has any abilities that result from its smell, such as an overpowering scent, those abilities are also negated.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The range increases to 30 feet, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
_source.name: Negate Aroma

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Pass Without Trace](/Spells.aspx?ID=215)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 356 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Kalekot](/Deities.aspx?ID=225), [Ketephys](/Deities.aspx?ID=110), [Ng](/Deities.aspx?ID=98), [Tanagaar](/Deities.aspx?ID=129)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You obscure the tracks you leave behind and make it harder for others to find you. The DC of checks to Track you gains a +4 status bonus or is equal to your spell DC, whichever results in a higher DC. You can benefit from only one _pass without trace spell_ at a time.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration increases to 8 hours.

**Heightened (4th)** The duration increases to 8 hours. The spell has a range of 20 feet and an area of a 20-foot-emanation, affecting up to 10 creatures of your choice within that area.
_source.name: Pass Without Trace

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 356 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deities** [Bastet](/Deities.aspx?ID=50), [Daikitsu](/Deities.aspx?ID=304), [Grandmother Spider](/Deities.aspx?ID=37) **Patron Theme** [Mosquito Witch](/Patrons.aspx?ID=10) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Duration** 10 minutes --- You transform into the battle form of a Tiny animal, such as a cat, insect, lizard, or rat. You can decide the specific type of animal (such as a rat or praying mantis), but this has no effect on the form's Size or statistics. While in this form, you gain the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) trait, and you can't make Strikes. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities:
  • AC = 15 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction.
  • Speed 20 feet.
  • Weakness 5 to physical damage. (If you take physical damage in this form, you take 5 additional damage.)
  • [Low-light vision](/Rules.aspx?ID=416) and imprecise [scent](/Rules.aspx?ID=417) 30 feet.
  • [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) and [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) modifiers of +10, unless your own modifier is higher; [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) modifier –4.
--- **Heightened (4th)** You can turn into a flying creature, such as a bird, which grants you a fly Speed of 20 feet.
_source.name: Pest Form

_source.deity_markdown: [Diomazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=190), [Doloras](/Deities.aspx?ID=168), [Groetus](/Deities.aspx?ID=38), [Shax](/Deities.aspx?ID=80), [Stag Mother of the Forest of Stones](/Deities.aspx?ID=172), [The Godclaw](/Deities.aspx?ID=198), [Vildeis](/Deities.aspx?ID=130), [Ydersius](/Deities.aspx?ID=323), [Zon-Kuthon](/Deities.aspx?ID=296)
_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 357 4.0 **Tradition** [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Deities** [Diomazul](/Deities.aspx?ID=190), [Doloras](/Deities.aspx?ID=168), [Groetus](/Deities.aspx?ID=38), [Shax](/Deities.aspx?ID=80), [Stag Mother of the Forest of Stones](/Deities.aspx?ID=172), [The Godclaw](/Deities.aspx?ID=198), [Vildeis](/Deities.aspx?ID=130), [Ydersius](/Deities.aspx?ID=323), [Zon-Kuthon](/Deities.aspx?ID=296) **Lesson** [Lesson of Vengeance](/Lessons.aspx?ID=5) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Saving Throw** Will **Duration** 1 minute --- Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and 1d4 persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately.
**Failure** The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is sickened 1. If the target recovers from being sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target is sickened 2. --- **Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.
_source.name: Phantom Pain

_source.text: Phantom Pain Two Actions Source Core Rulebook pg. 357 4.0 Tradition Occult Deities Diomazul, Doloras, Groetus, Shax, Stag Mother of the Forest of Stones, The Godclaw, Vildeis, Ydersius, Zon-Kuthon Lesson Lesson of Vengeance Cast somatic, verbal Range 30 feet Target 1 creature Saving Throw Will Duration 1 minute --- Illusory pain wracks the target, dealing 2d4 mental damage and 1d4 persistent mental damage. The target must attempt a Will save. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target takes full initial damage but no persistent damage, and the spell ends immediately. Failure The target takes full initial and persistent damage, and the target is sickened 1. If the target recovers from being sickened, the persistent damage ends and the spell ends. Critical Failure As failure, but the target is sickened 2. --- Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d4 and the persistent damage by 1d4.

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 359 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Spell Lists** [Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 10 feet **Target** 1 object (cook, lift, or tidy only) **Duration** sustained --- The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.
  • **Cook** Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
  • **Lift** Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
  • **Make** Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile—it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
  • **Tidy** Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.
Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.
_source.name: Prestidigitation

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 360 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Bloodlines** [Diabolic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=4), [Elemental](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=6) **Mysteries** [Ash](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=10), [Flames](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=5) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature --- A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach. The flame deals 2d4 fire damage. **Critical Success** The target takes double damage and 1d4 [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29).
**Success** The target takes full damage. --- **Heightened (+1)** Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Protection](/Spells.aspx?ID=238)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 361 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You ward a creature against a specified alignment. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful when you cast this spell. The target gains a +1 status bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against creatures and effects of the chosen alignment. This bonus increases to +3 against effects from such creatures that would directly control the target and against attacks made by summoned creatures of the chosen alignment.

 This spell gains the trait that opposes the alignment you chose—if you choose chaos, this spell gains the lawful trait, and vice versa; if you choose evil, this spell gains the good trait, and vice versa.
_source.name: Protection

<actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>

<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 362 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Bloodline**
[Wyrmblessed](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=17)

**Mystery**
[Lore](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=7)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** 1 minute ([somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284))

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the [school of magic](/Rules.aspx?ID=261).

 If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of your _read aura_ spell.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target up to 10 objects.

**Heightened (6th)** You can target any number of objects.
_source.name: Read Aura

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 366 4.0 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** touch **Target** 1 creature **Duration** 1 minute --- You ward a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends. **Critical Success** _Sanctuary_ ends.
**Success** The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.
**Failure** The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.
**Critical Failure** The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of _sanctuary_'s duration.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Force" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=75" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 368 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Bloodline**
[Draconic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=5)

**Mystery**
[Battle](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=2)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the start of your next turn
</row>

</column>

---

You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

 While the spell is in effect, you can use the [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the [_magic missile_](/Spells.aspx?ID=180) spell.

 Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The shield has Hardness 10.

**Heightened (5th)** The shield has Hardness 15.

**Heightened (7th)** The shield has Hardness 20.

**Heightened (9th)** The shield has Hardness 25.
_source.name: Shield

_source.text: Shield Single Action Source Core Rulebook pg. 368 4.0 Traditions Arcane, Divine, Occult Spell Lists Elemental Bloodline Draconic Mystery Battle Cast verbal Duration until the start of your next turn --- You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use. While the spell is in effect, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell. Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness. --- Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10. Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15. Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20. Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Shillelagh](/Spells.aspx?ID=282)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 369 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Andoletta](/Deities.aspx?ID=112), [Arundhat](/Deities.aspx?ID=186), [Elven Pantheon](/Deities.aspx?ID=197)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1  club  or  staff  you hold
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

The target grows vines and leaves, brimming with primal energy. The target becomes a _+1 striking weapon_ while in your hands, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two. Additionally, as long as you are on your home plane, attacks you make with the target against aberrations, extraplanar creatures, and undead increase the number of weapon damage dice to three.
_source.name: Shillelagh

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Shocking Grasp](/Spells.aspx?ID=283)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Attack" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=15" />
<trait label="Electricity" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=56" />
<trait label="Evocation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=65" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 369 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Baekho](/Deities.aspx?ID=299)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You shroud your hands in a crackling field of lightning. Make a melee spell attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 2d12 electricity damage. If the target is wearing metal armor or is made of metal, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll with _shocking grasp_, and the target also takes 1d4 persistent electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the persistent damage.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d12, and the persistent electricity damage increases by 1.
_source.name: Shocking Grasp

_source.markdown:
<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Sigil](/Spells.aspx?ID=286)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 369 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature or object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** unlimited (see below)
</row>

</column>

---

You harmlessly place your unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and you can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week. The time before the mark fades increases depending on your heightened level.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The sigil instead fades after 1 month.

**Heightened (5th)** The sigil instead fades after 1 year.

**Heightened (7th)** The sigil never fades.
_source.name: Sigil

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 370 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Deities** [Bes](/Deities.aspx?ID=51), [Desna](/Deities.aspx?ID=281), [Kitumu](/Deities.aspx?ID=229), [Luhar](/Deities.aspx?ID=216), [The Prismatic Ray](/Deities.aspx?ID=207) **Lesson** [Lesson of Dreams](/Lessons.aspx?ID=1) **Patron Theme** [Night](/Patrons.aspx?ID=5) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 5-foot burst **Saving Throw** Will --- Each creature in the area becomes drowsy and might fall asleep. A creature that falls unconscious from this spell doesn't fall prone or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.
**Critical Failure** The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically. --- **Heightened (4th)** The creatures fall unconscious for 1 round on a failure or 1 minute on a critical failure. They fall prone and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.
_source.name: Sleep

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Soothe](/Spells.aspx?ID=291)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Emotion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=60" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 370 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Tradition**
[Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Ashava](/Deities.aspx?ID=114), [Atreia](/Deities.aspx?ID=101), [Bolka](/Deities.aspx?ID=85), [Immonhiel](/Deities.aspx?ID=238), [Isis](/Deities.aspx?ID=54), [Kofusachi](/Deities.aspx?ID=309), [Korada](/Deities.aspx?ID=123), [Mother Vulture](/Deities.aspx?ID=142), [Naderi](/Deities.aspx?ID=157), [Osiris](/Deities.aspx?ID=56), [Phi Deva](/Deities.aspx?ID=301), [Qi Zhong](/Deities.aspx?ID=314), [Selket](/Deities.aspx?ID=59), [The Lost Prince](/Deities.aspx?ID=96), [The Offering Plate](/Deities.aspx?ID=254), [Tlehar](/Deities.aspx?ID=217), [Touch of the Sun](/Deities.aspx?ID=233), [Tsukiyo](/Deities.aspx?ID=317), [Wards of the Pharaoh](/Deities.aspx?ID=208)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You grace the target's mind, boosting its mental defenses and healing its wounds. The target regains 1d10+4 Hit Points when you Cast the Spell and gains a +2 status bonus to saves against mental effects for the duration.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The amount of healing increases by 1d10+4.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Spirit Link](/Spells.aspx?ID=302)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 371 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of Life](/Lessons.aspx?ID=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You form a spiritual link with another creature, allowing you to take in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained.

 This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve positive or negative energy, _spirit link_ works even if you or the target is undead. While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from regeneration or fast healing. You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, _spirit link_ ends automatically.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.
_source.name: Spirit Link

_source.text: Spirit Link Two Actions Source Core Rulebook pg. 371 4.0 Traditions Divine, Occult Lesson Lesson of Life Cast somatic, verbal Range 30 feet Target 1 willing creature Duration 10 minutes --- You form a spiritual link with another creature, allowing you to take in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained. This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve positive or negative energy, spirit link works even if you or the target is undead. While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from regeneration or fast healing. You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, spirit link ends automatically. --- Heightened (+1) The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 375 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Deities** [Baphomet](/Deities.aspx?ID=73), [Chamidu](/Deities.aspx?ID=188), [Lao Shu Po](/Deities.aspx?ID=312) **Cast** [material](/Rules.aspx?ID=282), [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- You conjure an animal to fight for you. You summon a common creature that has the [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=9) trait and whose level is –1, such as those below. Heightening the spell increases the maximum level of creature you can summon. --- **Heightened (2nd)** Level 1. **Heightened (3rd)** Level 2. **Heightened (4th)** Level 3. **Heightened (5th)** Level 5. **Heightened (6th)** Level 7. **Heightened (7th)** Level 9. **Heightened (8th)** Level 11. **Heightened (9th)** Level 13. **Heightened (10th)** Level 15. The Summon Trait Spells with the summon trait can conjure creatures, typically ones with a particular trait. Such creatures can be found in Monster Core and similar books. Unless noted otherwise, the creature must be common, it gains the summoned trait (page 301), and it must appear in an unoccupied space in range large enough to contain it. The highest level of creature the spell can summon depends on the rank of the spell, as listed below. The spell can still summon a creature of a lower level if you so choose. These rules apply only to spells that have the summon trait; other spells that call or conjure items or beings but that don’t have the trait, like summon instrument, work as explained in the spell. ## Summon Levels

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 377 4.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Bloodline** [Nymph](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=12) **Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature --- A vine covered in sticky sap appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack against the target. **Critical Success** The target gains the immobilized condition and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the immobilized condition.
**Success** The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.
**Failure** The target is unaffected. --- **Heightened (2nd)** The effects last for 2 rounds. **Heightened (4th)** The effects last for 1 minute.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[True Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=345)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 379 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodline**
[Draconic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=5)

**Deities**
[Achaekek](/Deities.aspx?ID=325), [Cernunnos](/Deities.aspx?ID=116), [Dammerich](/Deities.aspx?ID=117), [Eiseth](/Deities.aspx?ID=169), [Erastil](/Deities.aspx?ID=282), [Falayna](/Deities.aspx?ID=119), [General Susumu](/Deities.aspx?ID=306), [Gorum](/Deities.aspx?ID=283), [Iomedae](/Deities.aspx?ID=285), [Otolmens](/Deities.aspx?ID=145), [Ragathiel](/Deities.aspx?ID=126), [Raumya](/Deities.aspx?ID=195), [Sekhmet](/Deities.aspx?ID=58), [Shizuru](/Deities.aspx?ID=315), [Sorrow's Sword](/Deities.aspx?ID=249), [Srikalis, Sritaming, and Sribaril](/Deities.aspx?ID=302), [Yaezhing](/Deities.aspx?ID=318)

**Patron Theme**
[Fate](/Patrons.aspx?ID=3)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the end of your turn
</row>

</column>

---

A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being concealed or hidden.

_source.text: True Strike Single Action Source Core Rulebook pg. 379 4.0 Traditions Arcane, Occult Bloodline Draconic Deities Achaekek, Cernunnos, Dammerich, Eiseth, Erastil, Falayna, General Susumu, Gorum, Iomedae, Otolmens, Ragathiel, Raumya, Sekhmet, Shizuru, Sorrow's Sword, Srikalis, Sritaming, and Sribaril, Yaezhing Patron Theme Fate Cast verbal Duration until the end of your turn --- A glimpse into the future ensures your next blow strikes true. The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll the attack twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being concealed or hidden.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=356)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 381 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

Whenever you speak or make any other sound vocally, you can make your vocalization seem to originate from somewhere else within 60 feet, and you can change that apparent location freely as you vocalize. Any creature that hears the sound can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The spell's duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your  voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.
_source.name: Ventriloquism

<traits>

<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=19" />
<trait label="Composition" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=31" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />

<row gap="medium">
