<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 354 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Angazhan](/Deities.aspx?ID=72), [Apsu](/Deities.aspx?ID=149), [Barbatos](/Deities.aspx?ID=64), [Dahak](/Deities.aspx?ID=150), [Rowdrosh](/Deities.aspx?ID=240), [Zevgavizeb](/Deities.aspx?ID=82)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Glowing runes appear on the target's body. All its [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attacks become _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280)_ unarmed attacks, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of damage dice to two.

---
**Heightened (6th)** The unarmed attacks are _+2 greater striking_.

**Heightened (9th)** The unarmed attacks are _+3 major striking_.
_source.name: Runic Body

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 355 2.0 **Traditions** [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Range** touch **Target** 1 creature **Duration** 1 minute --- You ward a creature with protective energy that deters attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300), the spell ends. **Critical Success** _Sanctuary_ ends.
**Success** The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.
**Failure** The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.
**Critical Failure** The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=1671)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Force" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=75" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 356 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Bloodline**
[Draconic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=23)

**Mystery**
[Battle](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=13)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the start of your next turn
</row>

</column>

---

You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the [Raise a Shield](/Actions.aspx?ID=98) action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

 While the spell is in effect, you can use the [Shield Block](/Feats.aspx?ID=839) reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

---
**Heightened (+2)** The shield's Hardness increases by 5.
_source.name: Shield
_source.search_markdown:

<summary>

_source.summary: A shield of magical force blocks attacks and spells.
_source.summary_markdown: A shield of magical force blocks attacks and spells.
_source.text: Shield Single Action Source Player Core pg. 356 2.0 Traditions Arcane, Divine, Occult Spell Lists Elemental Bloodline Draconic Mystery Battle Duration until the start of your next turn --- You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use. While the spell is in effect, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. --- Heightened (+2) The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Sigil](/Spells.aspx?ID=1673)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 357 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 creature or object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** unlimited (see below)
</row>

</column>

---

You harmlessly place your unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and you can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week. The time before the mark fades increases depending on your heightened rank.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The sigil instead fades after 1 month.

**Heightened (5th)** The sigil instead fades after 1 year.

**Heightened (7th)** The sigil never fades.
_source.name: Sigil

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 357 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Deities** [Bes](/Deities.aspx?ID=51), [Desna](/Deities.aspx?ID=281), [Kitumu](/Deities.aspx?ID=229), [Luhar](/Deities.aspx?ID=216), [The Prismatic Ray](/Deities.aspx?ID=207) **Lesson** [Lesson of Dreams](/Lessons.aspx?ID=16) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 5-foot burst **Defense** Will --- Each creature in the area becomes drowsy, possibly nodding off. A creature that falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) from this spell doesn't fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.
**Critical Failure** The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically. --- **Heightened (4th)** The creatures fall unconscious for 1 round on a failure or 1 minute on a critical failure. They fall [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31) and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.
_source.name: Sleep

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Spirit Link](/Spells.aspx?ID=1686)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=149" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 358 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Lesson**
[Lesson of Life](/Lessons.aspx?ID=18)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You form a spiritual link with another creature, taking in its pain. When you Cast this Spell and at the start of each of your turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). You lose as many Hit Points as the target regained.

 This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points you lose. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points you or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve vitality or void energy, _spirit link_ works even if you or the target is [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). While the duration persists, you gain no benefit from [regeneration](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=26) or [fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15). You can Dismiss this spell, and if you're ever at 0 Hit Points, _spirit link_ ends automatically.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.
_source.name: Spirit Link

You materialize a handheld [musical instrument](/Equipment.aspx?ID=37) in your grasp. The instrument is typical for its type, but it plays for only you. It vanishes when the spell ends. If you cast _summon instrument_ again, any instrument you previously summoned disappears.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The instrument is instead a virtuoso handheld instrument.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Sure Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=1709)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 361 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Achaekek](/Deities.aspx?ID=325), [Cernunnos](/Deities.aspx?ID=116), [Dammerich](/Deities.aspx?ID=117), [Eiseth](/Deities.aspx?ID=169), [Erastil](/Deities.aspx?ID=282), [Falayna](/Deities.aspx?ID=119), [General Susumu](/Deities.aspx?ID=306), [Gorum](/Deities.aspx?ID=283), [Iomedae](/Deities.aspx?ID=285), [Otolmens](/Deities.aspx?ID=145), [Ragathiel](/Deities.aspx?ID=126), [Raumya](/Deities.aspx?ID=195), [Sekhmet](/Deities.aspx?ID=58), [Shizuru](/Deities.aspx?ID=315), [Sorrow's Sword](/Deities.aspx?ID=249), [Srikalis, Sritaming, and Sribaril](/Deities.aspx?ID=302), [Yaezhing](/Deities.aspx?ID=318)

**Patron Theme**
[Spinner of Threads](/Patrons.aspx?ID=16)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until the end of your turn
</row>

</column>

---

The next time you make an attack roll before the end of your turn, roll it twice and use the better result. The attack ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the target being [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=62) or [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79). You are then temporarily immune to sure strike for 10 minutes.
_source.name: Sure Strike

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 362 2.0 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** AC --- A vine appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack roll against the target. **Critical Success** The target gains the [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) condition and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the immobilized condition.
**Success** The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.
**Failure** The target is unaffected. --- **Heightened (2nd)** The effects last for 2 rounds. **Heightened (4th)** The effects last for 1 minute.
_source.name: Tangle Vine

<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 362 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 unattended object of Light bulk or less
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained
</row>

</column>

---

You create a floating, magical hand, either [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=26) or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and levitates it slowly up to 20 feet in any direction. When you Sustain the spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

**Heightened (5th)** The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.

**Heightened (7th)** The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
_source.name: Telekinetic Hand

**Success** You deal full damage. --- **Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d6.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Thunderstrike](/Spells.aspx?ID=1721)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Electricity" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=56" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Sonic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=147" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 363 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Baekho](/Deities.aspx?ID=299)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

You call down a tendril of lightning that cracks with thunder, dealing 1d12 electricity damage and 1d4 sonic damage to the target with a basic Reflex save. A target wearing metal armor or made of metal takes a –1 circumstance bonus to its save, and if damaged by the spell is [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for 1 round.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d12 electricity and 1d4 sonic.
_source.name: Thunderstrike

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You obscure the tracks you leave behind. The DC of checks to [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=66) you gains a +4 status bonus or is equal to your spell DC, whichever results in a higher DC.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The duration increases to 8 hours.

**Heightened (4th)** The duration increases to 8 hours. The spell has a range of 20 feet and an area of a 20-footemanation, affecting up to 10 creatures of your choice within that area.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Ventriloquism](/Spells.aspx?ID=1740)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=16" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=92" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 366 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

Whenever you speak or make any other sound vocally, you can make your vocalization seem to originate from somewhere else within 60 feet, and you can change that apparent location freely as you vocalize. Any creature that hears the sound can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The spell's duration increases to 1 hour, and you can also change the tone, quality, and other aspects of your voice. Before a creature can attempt to disbelieve your illusion, it must actively attempt a Perception check or otherwise use actions to interact with the sound.
_source.name: Ventriloquism

<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />

[Life](/Mysteries.aspx?ID=17)

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature that is undead or otherwise has void healing
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
basic Fortitude

</row>

</column>

---

You demolish the target's corrupted essence with energy from Creation's Forge. You deal 2d6 vitality damage with a basic Fortitude save. If the creature critically fails the save, it is also [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=71) 1 until the start of your next turn.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d6.
_source.name: Vitality Lash

_source.text: Courageous Anthem Single Action Source Player Core pg. 370 2.0 Area 60-foot emanation Duration 1 round --- You inspire yourself and your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Hymn of Healing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1768)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=546" />
<trait label="Composition" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=31" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Healing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=89" />
<trait label="Vitality" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=509" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 370 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** you or 1 ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 4 rounds
</row>

</column>

---

Your glorious singing mends wounds and provides a temporary respite from harm. The target gains [fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 2. When you Cast the Spell and the first time each round you Sustain the Spell, the target gains 2 temporary Hit Points, which last for 1 round.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The fast healing and temporary Hit Points each increase by 2
_source.name: Hymn of Healing

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 371 2.0 --- You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits. If your next action is to cast a cantrip composition with a duration of 1 round, attempt a Performance check. The DC is usually a [standard-difficulty DC of a level equal to the highest-level target of your composition](/Rules.aspx?ID=554), but the GM can assign a different DC based on the circumstances. The effect depends on the result of your check. **Critical Success** The composition lasts 4 rounds.
**Success** The composition lasts 3 rounds.
**Failure** The composition lasts 1 round, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.
_source.name: Lingering Composition

<row gap="medium">

 

**Trigger** You or an ally within range attempts a skill check to Recall Knowledge

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** you or the triggering ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

---

You call upon your muse's deep mysteries, granting the target a greater ability to think and recall information. Roll the triggering [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26) skill check twice and use the higher result.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Song of Strength](/Spells.aspx?ID=1775)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=546" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Composition" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=31" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 371 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 60-foot emanation

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

You bolster your allies' physical strength with a hearty exhortation. You and your allies gain a +1 status bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks and to their DCs against Athletics skill actions such as [Disarm](/Actions.aspx?ID=41), Reposition, [Shove](/Actions.aspx?ID=38), and [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40).
_source.name: Song of Strength

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Uplifting Overture](/Spells.aspx?ID=1779)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Bard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=546" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Composition" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=31" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Emotion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=60" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 372 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Target** 1 ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 round
</row>

</column>

---

Your performance makes allies feel they can succeed at anything. This counts as having prepared to [Aid](/Actions.aspx?ID=75) your ally on a skill check of your choice. When you later use the Aid reaction, you can roll [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) instead of the normal skill check, and if you roll a failure, you get a success instead. If you are legendary in Performance, you automatically critically succeed. The GM might rule that you can't use this ability if the act of encouraging your ally would interfere with the skill check (such as a check to [Sneak](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) quietly or maintain a disguise).
_source.name: Uplifting Overture

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 372 2.0 **Domain** [Air](/Domains.aspx?ID=65) **Range** 500 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** Fortitude --- Giving the air a push, you buffet the target with a powerful gust of wind; it must attempt a Fortitude save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is [pushed](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) 5 feet away from you.
**Failure** The target is pushed 10 feet away from you.
**Critical Failure** The target is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31).
_source.name: Pushing Gust

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 372 2.0 **Domain** [Ambition](/Domains.aspx?ID=64) **Trigger** You or an ally in range attempt to use a mental effect to convince a creature to do something (such as a Coerce, Request, or a suggestion spell) **Range** 60 feet **Target** one creature being influenced **Defense** Will --- You strengthen the target's ambition, increase its resentment of its allies, and make its allegiances more susceptible to change. It must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected and realized you attempted to influence its reaction with magic.
**Success** The target takes a –1 status penalty to its defenses against the triggering effect. This penalty is –2 if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions. The target doesn't realize you Cast the Spell on it.
**Failure** As success, but the status penalty is –4 if the target is being encouraged to advance its own ambitions.
**Critical Failure** As success, but the creature automatically follows a suggestion that advances its own ambitions.
_source.name: Ignite Ambition

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Face in the Crowd](/Spells.aspx?ID=1784)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Visual" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=163" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 372 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Cities](/Domains.aspx?ID=66)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, your appearance becomes bland and nondescript. You gain a +2 status bonus to [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) and [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) checks to go incognito among the crowd, and you ignore [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by the crowd. This counts as setting up a disguise for the [Impersonate](/Actions.aspx?ID=46) use of Deception and you add your level even if you're untrained.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The spell gains a range of 10 feet and can target up to 10 creatures.
_source.name: Face in the Crowd

<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You surround yourself in confidence. You reduce your current [frightened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19) condition by 1, and whenever you would become frightened during the duration, reduce the amount by 1. If you critically fail a save against a [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68) effect, _veil of confidence_ reduces your frightened value from that effect, and then ends.
_source.name: Veil of Confidence

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 373 2.0 **Domain** [Creation](/Domains.aspx?ID=68) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 5-foot burst **Defense** Will **Duration** varies --- A deluge of paint or colorful illusions descend on the area, reflecting your personal creative specialty. Roll 1d4 to determine the color of the illusion. Each creature in the area must succeed at a Will save or take the effect listed on the table for the color. ## Creative Splash
**1d4****Color****Failure****Critical Failure**
1White[Dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7) 1 roundDazzled 1 minute
2Red[Enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) for 1 roundEnfeebled 2 for 1 round
3Yellow[Frightened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=19)Frightened 2
4Blue[Clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=3) for 1 roundClumsy 2 for 1 round
_source.name: Creative Splash

Roll 1d4 to determine the color of the illusion. Each creature in the area must succeed at a Will save or take the effect listed on the table for the color. ## Creative Splash 1d4 Color Failure Critical Failure 1 White Dazzled 1 round Dazzled 1 minute 2 Red Enfeebled 1 for 1 round Enfeebled 2 for 1 round 3 Yellow Frightened 1 Frightened 2 4 Blue Clumsy 1 for 1 round Clumsy 2 for 1 round

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Cloak of Shadow](/Spells.aspx?ID=1790)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Aura" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=206" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Darkness" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=39" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Shadow" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=143" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 373 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Darkness](/Domains.aspx?ID=69)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You drape the target in a mantle of swirling shadows that make it harder to see. The cloak reduces [bright light](/Rules.aspx?ID=407) within a 20-foot emanation to [dim light](/Rules.aspx?ID=408). This is a form of magical [darkness](/Traits.aspx?ID=39) and can therefore overcome non-magical light or attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) magical light as described on page 431.

 The target can use [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) condition gained from the shadows to [Hide](/Actions.aspx?ID=62), though observant creatures can still follow the moving aura of shadow, making it difficult for the target to become completely [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39). The target can use an Interact action to remove the cloak and leave it behind as a decoy, where it remains, reducing light for the rest of the spell's duration. If anyone picks up the cloak after it's been removed by the original target, the cloak evaporates and the spell ends.
_source.name: Cloak of Shadow

[Death's Call](/Spells.aspx?ID=1792)
<actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 373 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Death](/Domains.aspx?ID=70)

<row gap="medium">

 

**Trigger** A living creature within 20 feet of you dies, or an undead creature within 20 feet of you is destroyed

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Seeing another pass from this world invigorates you. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to the triggering creature's level plus your spellcasting attribute modifier. If the triggering creature was [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160), double the number of temporary Hit Points you gain. These last for the duration of the spell, and the spell ends if all the temporary Hit Points are depleted earlier.
_source.name: Death's Call

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 374 2.0 **Domain** [Dreams](/Domains.aspx?ID=72) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 willing creature **Duration** 1 hour --- With soothing words, you lull the target into an enchanting dream. When you Cast the Spell, the target falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) if it wasn't already. While unconscious, it experiences a dream of your choice, though lucidly enough it can wake when it pleases. If it wakes up before 1 minute of sleep has passed, the spell ends.
  • **Dream of Insight** +1 status bonus to Intelligence-based skill checks
  • **Dream of Glamor** +1 status bonus to Charisma-based skill checks
  • **Dream of Voyaging** +5-foot status bonus to Speed.
If you Cast this Spell again, any previous sweet dream you cast ends. --- **Heightened (4th)** The bonus for a dream of insight or glamor is +2. **Heightened (7th)** The bonus for a dream of insight or glamor is +3.
_source.name: Sweet Dream

**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 ally
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You attempt to calm the target by uttering soothing words in a calm and even tone. The target gains a +1 status bonus to Will saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 against [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60) effects.

 In addition, when you Cast this Spell, you can attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) one emotion effect on the target.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The bonus to saves increases to +2, or +3 against emotion effects.
_source.name: Soothing Words

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Read Fate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1802)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Prediction" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=132" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 375 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Fate](/Domains.aspx?ID=75)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature other than you
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You attempt to learn more about the target's fate in the short term, usually within the next day for most prosaic creatures, or the next hour or less for someone likely to have multiple rapid experiences, such as someone actively adventuring.

 You learn a single enigmatic word connected to the creature's fate in that time frame. Fate is notoriously inscrutable, and the word isn't necessarily meant to be taken at face value, so the meaning is often clear only in hindsight. The GM rolls a secret DC 6 flat check. If the creature's fate is too uncertain, or on a failed flat check, the spell yields the word “inconclusive.” Either way, the creature is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
_source.name: Read Fate

---

A blazing band of fire arcs through the air, lighting your opponent and the ground they stand upon on fire. Make a spell attack roll against the target's AC. The ray deals 2d6 fire damage on a hit (or double damage on a critical hit). On any result other than a critical failure, the ground in the target's space catches fire, dealing 1d6 fire damage to each creature that ends its turn in one of the squares.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The ray's initial damage increases by 2d6, and the fire damage dealt by the burning space increases by 1d6.

_source.text: Fire Ray Two Actions Source Player Core pg. 375 2.0 Domain Fire Range 60 feet Target 1 creature Defense AC Duration until the end of the target's next turn --- A blazing band of fire arcs through the air, lighting your opponent and the ground they stand upon on fire. Make a spell attack roll against the target's AC. The ray deals 2d6 fire damage on a hit (or double damage on a critical hit). On any result other than a critical failure, the ground in the target's space catches fire, dealing 1d6 fire damage to each creature that ends its turn in one of the squares. --- Heightened (+1) The ray's initial damage increases by 2d6, and the fire damage dealt by the burning space increases by 1d6.

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Unimpeded Stride](/Spells.aspx?ID=1806)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 375 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Freedom](/Domains.aspx?ID=77)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

Divine grace ensure that nothing can keep you prisoner or hold you back. You immediately escape from every magical effect that has you [immobilized](/Conditions.aspx?ID=24) or [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) unless the effect is of a higher rank than your _unimpeded stride_ spell. You then Stride. During this movement, you ignore [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) and any circumstance or status penalties to your Speed.
_source.name: Unimpeded Stride

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Healer's Blessing](/Spells.aspx?ID=1808)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 375 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Healing](/Domains.aspx?ID=78)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing living creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Your words bless a creature with an enhanced connection to vital energy. When the target regains Hit Points from a [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89) [vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509) spell, it regains 2 additional Hit Points.

 The target regains additional Hit Points from _healer's blessing_ only the first time it regains HP from a given healing spell, so a spell that heals the creature repeatedly over a duration would restore additional Hit Points only once, when they are first healed.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The additional healing increases by 2 HP.
_source.name: Healer's Blessing

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 376 2.0 **Domain** [Indulgence](/Domains.aspx?ID=79) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 living creature **Defense** Fortitude --- Huge amounts of food and drink fill the target. It receives a full meal's worth of nourishment and must attempt a Fortitude save. A target [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) by this spell takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed until it's no longer sickened. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target is sickened 1, but if it spends an action to end the condition, it succeeds automatically.
**Failure** The target is sickened 1.
**Critical Failure** The target is sickened 2.
_source.name: Overstuff

Speaking a short prayer as you gather your thoughts, you're blessed to find yourself pointed in the right direction. The GM rolls the triggering check twice and uses the better result.

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Bit of Luck](/Spells.aspx?ID=1814)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 376 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Luck](/Domains.aspx?ID=81)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You tilt the scales of luck slightly to protect a creature from disaster. When the target would attempt a saving throw, it can roll twice and use the better result. Once it does this, the spell ends. If you cast _bit of luck_ again, any previous bit of luck you cast that's still in effect ends. After a creature has been targeted with _bit of luck_, it becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours.
_source.name: Bit of Luck

Your body fills with physical power and skill. You gain a +10- foot status bonus to Speed and a +2 status bonus to [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) checks. As a part of Casting this Spell, you can use a Stride, [Leap](/Actions.aspx?ID=81), [Climb](/Actions.aspx?ID=33), or [Swim](/Actions.aspx?ID=39) action. The spell's bonuses apply during that action.

_source.text: Waking Nightmare Two Actions Source Player Core pg. 377 2.0 Domain Nightmares Range 30 feet Target 1 creature Defense Will Duration varies --- You fill the creature's mind with a terrifying vision. The target must attempt a Will save. A creature frightened by this spell takes 1 additional mental damage each time it's hit by a Strike. Critical Success The target is unaffected. _source.markdown:
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 378 2.0 **Domain** [Passion](/Domains.aspx?ID=88) **Range** touch **Target** 1 creature that could find you attractive **Defense** Will **Duration** 10 minutes --- You infuse your target with attraction, causing it to act friendlier toward you. The target attempts a Will save. It gains a +4 circumstance bonus to this save if you or your allies recently threatened or were hostile to it. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.
**Success** The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charming touch, unless it identifies the spell (see Identifying Spells on page 303).
**Failure** The target's attitude becomes [friendly](/Conditions.aspx?ID=18) toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes [helpful](/Conditions.aspx?ID=21). It can't use [hostile actions](/Rules.aspx?ID=300) against you. If you use a hostile action against the target, the spell ends. You can Dismiss the spell. After the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations. If it doesn't realize you charmed it, you could potentially convince it to continue being your friend via mundane means.
**Critical Failure** As failure, but the target is helpful.
_source.name: Charming Touch

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 378 <sup>2.0</sup>

[Perfection](/Domains.aspx?ID=89)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You meditate upon perfection to remove all distractions from your mind. Attempt a new Will save against one [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) effect currently affecting you that required a Will save. Use the result of this new save to determine the outcome of the mental effect, unless the new save would have a worse result than the original save, in which case nothing happens. You can use _perfected mind_ against a given effect only once.

<actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 378 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Protection](/Domains.aspx?ID=90)

<row gap="medium">

 

**Trigger** An ally within 30 feet takes damage

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You protect your ally by suffering in their stead. Reduce the damage the ally would take by 3. You redirect this damage to yourself, but your immunities, weaknesses, resistances and so on do not apply

 You aren't subject to any conditions or other effects of whatever damaged your ally (such as [poison](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=24) from a venomous bite). Your ally is still subject to those effects even if you redirect all of the triggering damage to yourself.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage you redirect increases by 3.
_source.name: Protector's Sacrifice

<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Sonic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=147" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 379 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Secrecy](/Domains.aspx?ID=91)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Area** 15-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You suppress sound in an area, preventing anyone from giving away valuable secrets. This doesn't prevent those in the area from talking or Casting a Spell, but no creature more than 5 feet away can hear its voice without succeeding at a Perception check against your spell DC, which might interfere with [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) or [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101) effects as well as communication. Other sounds created in the area are muffled to a similar volume unless that sound is created by an effect with the [sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147) trait.
_source.name: Whispering Quiet

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Word of Truth](/Spells.aspx?ID=1842)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cleric" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=554" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 380 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Domain**
[Truth](/Domains.aspx?ID=95)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You speak a statement that you believe to be true and that is free of any attempt to deceive through twisting words, omission, and so on. The statement must be 25 words or fewer. A symbol of your deity glows above your head and lasts for the spell's duration, and anyone who sees you and hears you speak knows instinctively that you believe what you say is true. This assurance of honesty grants you a +2 status bonus to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) checks as long as the symbol persists. You can Dismiss the spell, and if you say something that you don't believe is entirely true, the spell ends before you complete your statement.
_source.name: Word of Truth

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 381 2.0 **Domain** [Wealth](/Domains.aspx?ID=99) **Range** 30 feet **Area** 5-foot burst **Defense** Will **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- You create a brief vision of immense wealth filling the spell's area. Each creature within 20 feet of the area that could be enticed by material wealth must attempt a Will saving throw. A creature that enters the area automatically disbelieves the illusion, and disbelieving the illusion ends any [fascinated](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14) condition imposed by the spell. As long as you Sustain the spell, other creatures react to the treasure like they would any other illusion, but they are not at risk of becoming fascinated. **Critical Success** The creature disbelieves the illusion and is unaffected by it.
**Success** The creature is fascinated by the wealth until it has completed its first action on its next turn.
**Failure** The creature is fascinated by the illusion.
_source.name: Appearance of Wealth

---

Holding your weapon aloft, you fill it with divine energy. On your next Strike with that weapon before the start of your next turn, you gain a +1 status bonus to the attack roll, the weapon deals an additional 1d6 spirit damage, and the Strike gains the [sanctified](/Traits.aspx?ID=519) trait. Weapon surge ends once you complete this Strike or the weapon leaves your possession.

---
**Heightened (5th)** The attack deals 2d6 additional spirit damage.

**Heightened (9th)** The attack deals 3d6 additional spirit damage.

Vines twine into a wicker horn in your hands, and out spills a single fruit, nut, or similar small bit of produce. A creature who eats the produce with an Interact action regains 1d6+4 HP. The cornucopia, as well as any unconsumed pieces of fruit, wither away at the end of the duration.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The cornucopia produces an additional piece of food. A creature can consume any amount of food from the same casting with a single Interact action. Eating six pieces of produce from the cornucopia gives as much nourishment as one square meal for a typical human.

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Untamed Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=1861)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Druid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=583" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Polymorph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=127" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 382 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** varies
</row>

</column>

---

You reach within for a different part of yourself, and you set it free, transforming your body into another form. You polymorph into any form listed in [_pest form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=217), which lasts 10 minutes. All other _untamed form_ shapes last 1 minute. You can add more shapes to your _untamed form_ list with druid feats; your feat might grant  you some or all of the shapes from a given [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127) spell. When you transform into a shape granted by a spell, you gain all the effects of the shape you chose from a version of the spell heightened to _untamed form'_s rank. _Untamed form_ allows you to use your own shapeshifting training more easily than most polymorph spells. When you choose to use your own attack modifier while polymorphed instead of the form's default attack modifier, you gain a +2 status bonus to your attack rolls.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can transform into shapes listed in [_animal form_](/Spells.aspx?ID=10).
_source.name: Untamed Form

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 383 2.0 **Duration** 1 minute --- You transform just a part of your body. Choose any one effect that matches an untamed order feat you have.
  • **Untamed Form** Your hands transform into incredibly sharp claws. Untamed claws are an unarmed attack, have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170) and [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179) traits, and deal 1d6 slashing damage. You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you must have a hand free to attack with it.
  • **Insect Shape** Your mouth becomes deadly jaws. Untamed jaws are an unarmed attack that deal 1d8 piercing damage.
  • **Elemental Shape** You shift your body to be partially composed of elemental matter, granting you resistance 5 to critical hits and precision damage.
  • **Plant Shape** Your arms become long vines, increasing your [reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192) to 10 feet (or 15 feet with a reach weapon).
  • **Soaring Shape** You must cast _untamed shift_ using 2 actions for this benefit. You grow wings from your back, gaining a fly Speed of 30 feet.
--- **Heightened (6th)** You can choose up to two effects from the list. Untamed claws leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 2d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) on a hit, and untamed jaws are envenomed, also dealing 2d6 persistent poison damage on a hit. **Heightened (10th)** You can choose up to three effects from the list. Untamed claws deal 4d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit, and untamed jaws deal 4d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.
_source.name: Untamed Shift

_source.summary_markdown: You transform just a part of your body.
_source.text: Untamed Shift Single Action to Two Actions Source Player Core pg. 383 2.0 Duration 1 minute --- You transform just a part of your body. Choose any one effect that matches an untamed order feat you have. Untamed Form Your hands transform into incredibly sharp claws. Untamed claws are an unarmed attack, have the agile and finesse traits, and deal 1d6 slashing damage. You can still hold and use items with your hands while they're transformed by this spell, but you must have a hand free to attack with it. Insect Shape Your mouth becomes deadly jaws. Untamed jaws are an unarmed attack that deal 1d8 piercing damage. Elemental Shape You shift your body to be partially composed of elemental matter, granting you resistance 5 to critical hits and precision damage. Plant Shape Your arms become long vines, increasing your reach to 10 feet (or 15 feet with a reach weapon). Soaring Shape You must cast untamed shift using 2 actions for this benefit. You grow wings from your back, gaining a fly Speed of 30 feet. --- Heightened (6th) You can choose up to two effects from the list. Untamed claws leave terrible, ragged wounds that also deal 2d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit, and untamed jaws are envenomed, also dealing 2d6 persistent poison damage on a hit. Heightened (10th) You can choose up to three effects from the list. Untamed claws deal 4d6 persistent bleed damage on a hit, and untamed jaws deal 4d6 persistent poison damage on a hit.

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 386 2.0 **Lesson** [Lesson of Dreams](/Lessons.aspx?ID=16) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** Will **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- Your patron draws the target into a drowsy state, causing daydreams and sluggishness. The target must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception, attack rolls, and Will saves. This penalty increases to –2 for Will saves against [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145) effects.
**Failure** As success, and any time the target uses a [concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32) action, it must succeed at a DC 5 flat check or the action is disrupted.
_source.name: Veil of Dreams

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 386 2.0 **Patron Theme** [Silence in Snow](/Patrons.aspx?ID=15) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** Reflex **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- Freezing sleet and heavy snowfall collect on the target's feet and legs, dealing 1d4 cold damage and other effects depending on its Reflex save. **Critical Success** The target is unaffected.
**Success** The target takes half damage.
**Failure** The target takes full damage and a –5-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the spell ends.
**Critical Failure** The target takes double damage and a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the spell ends. --- **Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.

<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Hex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=324" />

**Patron Theme**
[The Inscribed One](/Patrons.aspx?ID=13)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Your patron deigns to whisper a few secrets. The target can [Recall Knowledge](/Actions.aspx?ID=26), [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84), or [Sense Motive](/Actions.aspx?ID=85) as a free action. The target gains a +1 status bonus to the statistic used for the roll (a skill or Perception) on the roll and as long as you Sustain the spell. The target is temporarily immune to discern secrets for 1 minute.

---
**Heightened (5th)** You can target two creatures instead of one.
_source.name: Discern Secrets

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Nudge Fate](/Spells.aspx?ID=1890)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Hex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=324" />
<trait label="Witch" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=734" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 387 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Patron Theme**
[Spinner of Threads](/Patrons.aspx?ID=16)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

The barest spin of your patron's spool is enough to alter fate. When the target fails an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw and a +1 status bonus would turn a critical failure into a failure, or failure into a success, you grant the target a +1 status bonus to the check retroactively, changing the outcome appropriately. The spell then ends.

 If you cast _nudge fate_ while a previous casting of this hex is still in effect, the previous effect ends.
_source.name: Nudge Fate

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 387 2.0 **Patron Theme** [Starless Shadow](/Patrons.aspx?ID=17) **Range** 30 feet **Target** 1 creature **Defense** Will **Duration** sustained up to 1 minute --- Your patron blankets the target's eyes in darkness. If you cast this hex on a willing ally (for instance, one with [light blindness](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=22)), the ally can choose which result it gets without rolling. **Success** The target is unaffected.
**Failure** The target is shrouded in murky darkness. It treats [bright light](/Rules.aspx?ID=407) as [dim light](/Rules.aspx?ID=408), and unless it has [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), all creatures are [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4) to it.
_source.name: Shroud of Night

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Earthworks](/Spells.aspx?ID=1900)
<actions string="Single Action to Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=55" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=735" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 388 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 60 feet

**Area** 5-foot burst or more

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

With a ripple of earth, you raise small barriers from the ground. The ground in the area becomes [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453). The spell's area is a 5-foot burst if you spent 1 action to cast it, a 10-foot burst if you spent 2 actions, or a 15-foot burst if you spent 3 actions. A creature can Interact to clear the barriers from one 5-foot square adjacent to it.

---
**Heightened (4th)** You pull the barriers to float in the air, causing the spell to function as difficult terrain for flying creatures.
_source.name: Earthworks

<title level="1" right="Focus 1" pfs="Standard">
[Hand of the Apprentice](/Spells.aspx?ID=1906)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Attack" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=15" />
<trait label="Focus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=511" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Wizard" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=735" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 388 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 500 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
AC

</row>

</column>

---

You take advantage of one of the most fundamental lessons of magic to levitate and propel your weapon. You hurl a held melee weapon with which you are trained at the target, making a spell attack roll. On a success, you deal the weapon's damage as if you had hit with a melee Strike, but add your spellcasting attribute modifier to damage, rather than your Strength modifier. On a critical success, you deal double damage, and you add the weapon's [critical specialization effect](/Rules.aspx?ID=235). Regardless of the outcome, the weapon flies back to you and returns to your hand.
_source.name: Hand of the Apprentice

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Bullhorn](/Spells.aspx?ID=1971)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Auditory" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=541" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=550" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=629" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 241 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You amplify your voice, loud enough for you to be heard easily at a great distance. For the duration, your voice can be heard loudly and clearly by all listeners within 500 feet, even if other ambient noise would otherwise block the sound. Despite the volume, this doesn't make your voice jarring or distracting. This doesn't increase the range or area of other [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=541) or [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=642) effects, and physical barriers such as walls and doors still block or muffle your voice as normal.

 Your loud voice makes it easier to [Coerce](/Actions.aspx?ID=2394) others, and the acoustics assist in [Performing](/Actions.aspx?ID=2401) at a large venue. You gain a +1 status bonus to checks to Coerce and auditory [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) checks to Perform at a large venue.

 You can Dismiss the spell.

---
**Heightened (5th)** Your voice can be heard clearly up to 1,200 feet away.

**Heightened (7th)** Your voice can be heard clearly up to 1 mile away
_source.name: Bullhorn

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Carryall](/Spells.aspx?ID=1972)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Force" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=610" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 242 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deities**
[Casandalee](/Deities.aspx?ID=34), [Horus](/Deities.aspx?ID=53)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 8 hours
</row>

</column>

---

A small platform of magical force materializes adjacent to you to carry cargo. It is [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=83) or has a ghostly appearance, is 2 feet in diameter, and follows 5 feet behind you, floating just above the ground. It holds up to 5 Bulk of objects (if they can fit on it). Any objects atop the platform fall to the ground when the spell ends. You can Sustain the spell to move the platform up to 30 feet along the ground, to make it stay in place, or to have it return to you and resume following you.

 The spell ends if a creature tries to ride atop the platform, if the platform is overloaded, if anyone tries to lift or force the platform higher above the ground, or if you move more than 60 feet away from the platform.

---
**Heightened (4th)** The platform can carry 10 Bulk, creatures can ride atop it, and it can hover in the air, not just on the ground.
_source.name: Carryall

Single Action The spell deals 1d4 sonic damage to a single enemy, with a basic Fortitude save. Two Actions (manipulate) The spell deals 2d4 sonic damage to all creatures in a 10-foot burst, with a basic Fortitude save. Three Actions (manipulate) The spell deals 2d4 sonic damage to all creatures in a 30-foot emanation, with a basic Fortitude save --- Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d4 for the 1-action version, or 2d4 for the other versions.

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Déjà Vu](/Spells.aspx?ID=1986)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Incapacitation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=631" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=647" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 244 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Deity**
[Bergelmir](/Deities.aspx?ID=237)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 100 feet

**Target** 1 creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
Will

**Duration** 2 rounds
</row>

</column>

---

You loop a thought process in the target's mind, forcing it to repeat a moment's worth of actions. The target must attempt a Will save. If the target fails, whatever actions the target uses on its next turn, it must repeat on its following turn. The actions must be repeated in the same order and as close to the same specifics as possible. For example, if the target makes an attack, it must repeat the attack against the same creature, if possible, and if the target moves, it must move the same distance and direction, if possible, on its next turn.

 If the target can't repeat an action, such as Casting a Spell that has been exhausted or needing to target a creature that has died, it can act as it chooses for that action but becomes [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) until the end of its turn.
_source.name: Déjà Vu

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Imprint Message](/Spells.aspx?ID=2003)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 247 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Tradition**
[Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You project psychic vibrations onto the target object, imprinting it with a short message or emotional theme of your design. This imprinted sensation is revealed to a creature who casts [_object reading_](/Spells.aspx?ID=705) on the target object, replacing any emotional events the item was present for. If the object is in the area of a [_retrocognition_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1652) spell, the imprinted messages appear as major events in the timeline, but they don't interfere with any other visions.

 If the object is targeted with [_read aura_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1646) of a higher spell rank than _imprint message_, the caster learns that the object has been magically modified. When you Cast this Spell, any prior vibrations placed on an object by previous castings of _imprint message_ fade.
_source.name: Imprint Message

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Invisible Item](/Spells.aspx?ID=2004)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Illusion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=629" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 247 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** touch

**Target** 1 object
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 hour
</row>

</column>

---

You make the object [invisible](/Conditions.aspx?ID=83). This makes it [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) to them instead if they succeed. If the item is used as part of a [hostile action](/Rules.aspx?ID=300), the spell ends after that hostile action is completed. Making a weapon invisible typically doesn't give any advantage to the attack, except that an invisible thrown weapon or piece of ammunition can be used for an attack without necessarily giving information about the attacker's hiding place unless the weapon returns to the attacker.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The duration is until the next time you make your daily preparations.

**Heightened (7th)** The duration is unlimited.
_source.name: Invisible Item

---

You place a hand on an object to learn a piece of information about an emotional event that occurred involving the object within the past week, determined by the GM. If you cast object reading on the same item multiple times, you can either concentrate on a single event to gain additional pieces of information about that event or gain a piece of information about another emotional event in the applicable time frame.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last month.

**Heightened (4th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last year.

**Heightened (6th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last decade.

**Heightened (8th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the last century.

**Heightened (9th)** You can learn about an event that occurred within the entirety of the object's history.
_source.name: Object Reading

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Protector Tree](/Spells.aspx?ID=2015)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=668" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 249 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deity**
[Verilorn](/Deities.aspx?ID=276)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A Medium tree suddenly grows in an unoccupied square within range. The tree has AC 10 and 10 Hit Points. Whenever an ally adjacent to the tree is hit by a Strike, the tree interposes its branches and takes the damage first. Any additional damage beyond what it takes to reduce the tree to 0 Hit Points is dealt to the original target. The tree isn't large enough to impede movement through its square.

 If the tree is in soil and survives to the end of the spell's duration, it remains as an ordinary, non-magical tree and continues to grow and thrive. The GM might determine that the tree disappears immediately in certain inhospitable situations.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The tree has an additional 10 Hit Points.
_source.name: Protector Tree

[Scatter Scree](/Spells.aspx?ID=2021)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=550" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Earth" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=585" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 250 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=2297) Reflex

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

A jumble of rocks cascades into the area. The scattering rocks deal 2d4 bludgeoning damage (basic Reflex save). The ground in the area becomes [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) for the duration of the spell. A creature can Interact to clear a square of this scree.

 If you cast this spell again, any previous _scatter scree_ you've cast ends.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 250 1.1 **Traditions** [Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3) **Trigger** You critically fail a saving throw against a foe’s effect. **Range** 30 feet **Target** the triggering foe **Defense** Will --- You distract your enemy with their feeling of smug pleasure when you fail catastrophically. It must attempt a Will save. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature is distracted by its amusement and takes a –1 status penalty on Perception checks and Will saves for 1 round.
**Failure** The creature is overcome by its amusement and is [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=94) for 1 round.
**Critical Failure** The creature is lost in its amusement and is stupefied 2 for 1 round and stunned 1.

<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="Standard">
[Spout](/Spells.aspx?ID=2031)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=550" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Water" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=732" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 252 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Area** a 5-foot cube

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=2297) Reflex

</row>

</column>

---

Water blasts upward, coming out of the ground, rising from a pool, or even manifesting from thin air. Any creatures in the area take 2d4 bludgeoning damage, with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex saving throw. A creature that critically fails its save is disoriented by the explosion of water, becoming off-guard until the end of your next turn.

 You can change this spell's area to a 5-foot burst, provided you center the burst in a body of water. This body of water can be as small as a pond or creek, but not as small as a puddle or bathtub.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 1d4.
_source.name: Spout

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Limited">
[Summon Lesser Servitor](/Spells.aspx?ID=2034)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Summon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=520" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 253 <sup>1.1</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) spell may be used, but imps may not be summoned_

**Tradition**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** sustained up to 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

While deities jealously guard their most powerful servants from the summoning spells of those who aren't steeped in the faith, this spell allows you to conjure an inhabitant of the [Outer Sphere](/Rules.aspx?ID=3024) with or without the deity's permission. You summon a common [celestial](/Traits.aspx?ID=551), [fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=600), or [monitor](/Traits.aspx?ID=655) of level –1. You can choose to instead summon an [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) of level –1 that hails from the Outer Sphere; you can choose for this animal to gain the celestial and [holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) traits, the fiend and [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) traits, or the monitor trait.

It's anathema to summon a servitor if it has a holy or unholy trait that isn't allowed for your deity's sanctification. For example, [Sarenrae's](/Deities.aspx?ID=292) sanctification is “can choose holy,” so you couldn't summon an unholy creature, and [Pharasma's](/Deities.aspx?ID=290) is “none,” so you couldn't summon a holy or unholy creature. The GM might determine that your deity restricts specific types of creatures further, making it anathema to summon them as well.

---
**Heightened (2nd)** The creature can be level 1 or lower.

**Heightened (3rd)** The creature can be level 2 or lower.

**Heightened (4th)** The creature can be level 3 or lower.
_source.name: Summon Lesser Servitor

<title level="1" right="Spell 1" pfs="Standard">
[Thoughtful Gift](/Spells.aspx?ID=2037)
<actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=645" />
<trait label="Teleportation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=710" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 253 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Target** 1 willing creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

You teleport one object of light or negligible Bulk held in your hand to the target. The object appears instantly in the target's hand if they have a free hand, or at their feet if they don't. The target knows what object you're attempting to send them. If the target is [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=95) or refuses to accept your gift, or if the spell would teleport a creature (even if the creature is inside an [extradimensional](/Traits.aspx?ID=596) container), the spell fails.

---
**Heightened (3rd)** The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

**Heightened (5th)** As 3rd level, and the object's maximum Bulk increases to 1. You can Cast the Spell with 3 actions instead of 1; doing so increases the range to 1 mile, and you don't need line of sight to the target, but you must be extremely familiar with the target.
_source.name: Thoughtful Gift

_source.text: Lay on Hands Single Action Source Player Core 2 pg. 255 1.1 Range touch Target 1 willing living creature or 1 undead creature --- Your hands become infused with powerful vitality, capable of healing a living creature or damaging an undead creature with a touch. Willing Living Creature The target regains 6 Hit Points. If the target is someone other than yourself, it also gains a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round. Undead Creature The target takes 1d6 vitality damage with a basic Fortitude save; on a failure, the target also takes a –2 status penalty to AC for 1 round. --- Heightened (+1) The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to an undead target increases by 1d6.

_source.markdown:
**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 255 1.1 **Range** touch **Target** 1 willing undead creature or 1 living creature --- You infuse the target with void energy, healing [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722) or damaging a living creature.
  • **Willing Undead Creature** The target regains 6 Hit Points. If the target is yourself, you also gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 round.
  • **Living Creature** The target takes 1d6 void damage with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save; on a failure, the target also takes a –2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.
--- **Heightened (+1)** The amount of healing increases by 6, and the damage to a living target increases by 1d6.
_source.name: Touch of the Void
